Daniël van der Winden

Work

I'm an Amsterdam-based (software) designer and writer with over a decade of experience designing digital products, leading teams, and setting direction. I've worked with clients of all sizes, on projects of all shapes.
  • Most recently I worked for Ghost, designing and building tools for writers, journalists and publishers.
  • Before that I helped mould the design studio Bakken & Bæck into what it is today by building teams, shaping strategy, and delivering products—from zero to one.
  • I curate, edit, design and publish a printed, literary magazine called TRANSCRIPT.

I'm open to new opportunities, contract or permanent.
If you are in need of someone with my profile, please reach out. I'm especially interested in working with consumer-facing companies in the space of publishing, culture, music, film, media or design tooling.

Email me
LinkedIn Bluesky

Resumé

  • 2023–2025

    Senior Designer at Ghost

    I was involved in designing new features and explorative brand work, and coded numerous improvements throughout the product and its marketing site.
  • 2019–2023

    CDO, Partner at Bakken & Bæck

    As Partner, I was involved in setting the company's strategy. As CDO, I focused on our Product Design work and team—from securing projects to hiring new team members, and from elevating our reputation externally to enabling Product Designers to do their best work.
  • 2015–2019

    Designer, Head of Bakken & Bæck in Amsterdam

    Built a multi-disciplinary team of up to 20 people, mentored designers and other team members and helped the company take root in the Netherlands.
  • 2014–2015

    Designer at Fabrique

  • 2013–2014

    Internships at Fabrique and Bakken & Bæck

  • 2010–2012

    Internship at Faster Forward Interactive

    Followed by a stint as a part-time front-end developer.

I deliver polished user interfaces and quality prototypes. With a strong interest in typography and a knack for storytelling, I'm equally comfortable designing complex flows as I am putting together a marketing website.

Ghost

Designing and building tools for writers, journalists and publishers

While at Ghost I designed an upgraded publishing workflow, lowering the barrier for publishers to share their work with their audience. I also contributed to the integration of custom fonts, was involved in Ghost's exploratory brand work, and I designed and built numerous improvements throughout the product.

Whether leading his own projects or working as part of a team, Daniël's work is always exceptional. The thought process behind his designs is truly outstanding, and his attention to detail ensures a high-quality result. As a collaborator, his communication skills made the process a true pleasure.

— Sodbileg Gansukh, Product Designer at Ghost

Circle

Product design for a circular office rental platform

At Bakken & Bæck I led the product design for Circle, IKEA's circular rental solution for office furnishing. We designed and built a digital solution that enabled small businesses to design, experience and explore their space in mixed reality. Rapidly iterating, we conceptualised and designed the product from zero to one, laying the groundwork for what would become Nornorm.

Pexip

Designing a suite of videoconferencing software

In collaboration with Pexip's team I led design on their web, iOS and Android apps for videoconferencing. We also designed Pexip Room, which allowed people to join Pexip meetings using Logitech hardware. We implemented Pexip's privacy-first approach to software design and designed the software for Logitech's Tap device based on Android's Material Design language.

Daniël is the best designer I've worked with so far in my career. Impeccable attention to detail and a great problem-solver. He's also very friendly, easy to work with and delivers on time despite tight turnaround times.

— Sven-Petter Mæhle, Pexip

In addition, I've worked on end-to-end projects for Coinbase, AutoStore, Wake, and Expo.

Design Leadership

I've managed and mentored teams of up to 12 product designers with varying levels of experience, balancing their personal goals and needs with those of the business.

Daniël creates a positive, supportive environment where everyone can thrive. When he left the company, it felt like a huge part of the team spirit was missing.

— Marek Minor, Product Designer

Writing

I write essays, reviews, and a dash of auto-fiction. I've published two essays in TRANSCRIPT and write a monthly newsletter about the books I loved reading, called Trema.

Most recently I've acted as the copywriter and editor on the NoGood art book, due for publication this summer.
